actor_awards.notes: Paget received the Golden Boot Award in 1987 for her significant contributions to the Western genre.

filmography.title: The Ten Commandments
filmography.role_description: A gentle Hebrew water girl who becomes the love interest of Joshua and is nearly forced into concubinage by the Egyptian master builder Baka.
filmography.plot: The Egyptian Prince Moses learns of his true heritage as a Hebrew and his divine mission as the deliverer of his people.
filmography.awards: Oscar: Win – Best Special Effects; AFI: 100 Years... 100 Cheers (#79)

filmography.title: Broken Arrow
filmography.role_description: A young Apache maiden ('Morning Star') who marries the white scout Tom Jeffords, bridging the gap between their two warring cultures.
filmography.plot: Tom Jeffords tries to make peace between settlers and Apaches in the Arizona territory by befriending the Apache leader Cochise.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Win – Best Film Promoting International Understanding

filmography.title: Love Me Tender
filmography.role_description: The wife of the youngest Reno brother, who struggles with her lingering feelings for his older brother who was presumed dead in the Civil War.
filmography.plot: A Confederate team is ordered to rob a Union payroll train but the war ends just before the robbery, leading to internal conflict and tragedy.

filmography.title: The Indian Tomb
filmography.role_description: A temple dancer who performs a mesmerizing and provocative snake dance that becomes central to the plot and legendary in cinema history.
filmography.plot: The second part of Fritz Lang's Indian Epic, following the architect Harald and the dancer Seetha as they flee from a jealous Maharaja.

filmography.title: Cry of the City
filmography.role_description: The innocent, loyal girlfriend of a charismatic career criminal who tries to shield him from the police.
filmography.plot: A cop-killer fugitive tries to clear his name and escape the law while a determined police lieutenant tracks him down.

filmography.title: House of Strangers
filmography.role_description: The young, traditional fiancée of Max Monetti who is ultimately left behind as he becomes embroiled in his family's bitter feud.
filmography.plot: A domineering Italian-American banker alienates three of his four sons, leading to a family vendetta and criminal charges.
filmography.awards: Cannes Film Festival: Win – Best Actor (Edward G. Robinson)

filmography.title: Fourteen Hours
filmography.role_description: A spectator in the crowd watching a suicidal man on a ledge, whose own romantic relationship is affected by the unfolding drama.
filmography.plot: A police officer tries to talk a distraught young man down from the ledge of a high-rise hotel over the course of fourteen tense hours.

filmography.title: It Happens Every Spring
filmography.role_description: The supportive fiancée of a chemistry professor who accidentally discovers a formula that makes baseballs repel wood.
filmography.plot: A college professor discovers a wood-repelling formula and uses it to become a star pitcher for the St. Louis Cardinals.

filmography.title: Les Misérables
filmography.role_description: The adult daughter of Fantine who is raised by Jean Valjean and falls in love with the revolutionary Marius.
filmography.plot: In 19th-century France, a relentless policeman pursues an ex-convict who has reinvented himself as a mayor and factory owner.

filmography.title: Tales of Terror
filmography.role_description: The wife of a dying man who is hypnotized at the moment of death, trapping his soul in a horrifying state of limbo.
filmography.plot: Three stories adapted from Edgar Allan Poe: a grieving widower, a vengeful husband, and a mesmerizing hypnotist.

filmography.title: The Haunted Palace
filmography.role_description: The wife of Charles Dexter Ward, who watches in horror as her husband is possessed by the spirit of his warlock ancestor.
filmography.plot: A man arrives in a New England town to claim his family castle, only to find the townspeople hostile and the castle possessed by an ancient curse.

filmography.title: The Tiger of Eschnapur
filmography.role_description: A beautiful temple dancer who falls in love with a European architect, sparking the jealousy of a powerful Maharaja.
filmography.plot: A German architect travels to India to build a temple and falls for a dancer who is promised to the Maharaja.

filmography.title: Demetrius and the Gladiators
filmography.role_description: A devout Christian woman who loves Demetrius and fights to keep his faith alive amidst the corruption of Rome.
filmography.plot: A sequel to 'The Robe', following the Christian slave Demetrius as he is forced to fight in the Roman arena as a gladiator.

filmography.title: Prince Valiant
filmography.role_description: The beautiful younger sister of Princess Aleta who catches the eye of Sir Gawain in this adaptation of the classic comic strip.
filmography.plot: A young Viking prince strives to become a knight at King Arthur's Round Table and restore his exiled father to his throne.

filmography.title: White Feather
filmography.role_description: A Cheyenne woman who falls in love with a white surveyor, creating tension between her tribe and the encroaching settlers.
filmography.plot: A government surveyor tries to persuade a Cheyenne tribe to move to a reservation peacefully, but his romance with an Indian girl complicates matters.

filmography.title: The River's Edge
filmography.role_description: The wife of a rancher who is held hostage by her former lover, a criminal forcing them to guide him across the border.
filmography.plot: A killer on the run forces a rancher and his wife to guide him across the desert into Mexico with a stolen fortune.

filmography.title: Anne of the Indies
filmography.role_description: The gentle wife of a French naval officer who becomes a pawn in a pirate queen's game of jealousy and revenge.
filmography.plot: A female pirate captain falls in love with a Frenchman who is actually a naval officer trying to capture her.

filmography.title: Stars and Stripes Forever
filmography.role_description: A burlesque singer and dancer who becomes the romantic interest of a young Marine in this biopic of John Philip Sousa.
filmography.plot: A biography of the famous American composer and bandleader John Philip Sousa, featuring his most famous marches.
filmography.awards: Golden Globe: Nominated – Best Motion Picture – Musical/Comedy

filmography.title: Bird of Paradise
filmography.role_description: A Polynesian princess who falls in love with a white visitor, leading to a tragic clash between love and tribal tradition.
filmography.plot: A young Frenchman visits a South Sea island and marries the chief's daughter, but their happiness is threatened by the island's volcano.

filmography.title: Seven Angry Men
filmography.role_description: The wife of John Brown's son, caught up in the violent crusade of her father-in-law against slavery.
filmography.plot: The story of abolitionist John Brown and his fanatical campaign to end slavery in the United States, culminating in the raid on Harpers Ferry.

filmography.title: Belles on Their Toes
filmography.role_description: One of the elder daughters in the Gilbreth family, helping her mother manage the chaotic household after her father's death.
filmography.plot: The sequel to 'Cheaper by the Dozen', following the Gilbreth family as the mother continues her husband's efficiency work while raising twelve children.

filmography.title: Princess of the Nile
filmography.role_description: An Egyptian princess who leads a double life as a dancer to help her people overthrow a Bedouin conqueror.
filmography.plot: In 13th-century Egypt, a princess masquerades as a common dancer to organize a revolt against a tyrant.

filmography.title: From the Earth to the Moon
filmography.role_description: The daughter of an inventor who stows away on her father's rocket ship to the moon to be with her lover.
filmography.plot: An inventor and a munitions tycoon join forces to build a rocket ship to the moon, facing sabotage and danger along the way.

filmography.title: Omar Khayyam
filmography.role_description: The great love of the poet Omar Khayyam, who is forced to marry the Shah of Persia, inspiring Khayyam's famous verses.
filmography.plot: The life and loves of the famous Persian poet and mathematician Omar Khayyam, set against court intrigue and the threat of the Assassins.

filmography.title: Most Dangerous Man Alive
filmography.role_description: The former girlfriend of a gangster who becomes a target when he turns into a steel-skinned mutant seeking revenge.
filmography.plot: A racketeer exposed to cobalt radiation turns into a man of steel and seeks revenge against those who betrayed him.
